summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Bruce, Jack - Rope Ladder To The Moon Review Date: 2012/04/23 Store: Jack Bruce (Actor), Tony Palmer (Director) Rated: NR Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Documentary Product Description: ['NTSC/Region 0. DVD containing a documentary from British bassist (and former Cream member) Jack Bruce. In 1970, Jack released a Jazz-orientated LP of his own compositions called Songs for a Tailor. This 55 minute film, made at the same time, takes Jack from the Gorbals, via Cream, to his island called Sanda, playing the cello, the sitar and thundering away on the organ of the Albert Hall in London, while featuring many of the tracks from his LP. With his strong socialist principles, Jack Bruce himself provides the striking commentary. Originally shown on the BBC in 1971. Voiceprint.'] Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'TPDVD104', 'Director': 'Tony Palmer', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC', 'Run time': '55 minutes', 'Release date': 'October 5, 2010', 'Actors': 'Jack Bruce', 'Studio': 'Gonzo Distribution', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: Palmer's take on Jack Bruce's unique musical life sheds a bright light on an often overlooked aspect of poor, post-war Scotland and the influence it had on Bruce's music. Review Title: Unique Insight Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Blood And Orchids Review Date: 2012/12/22 Store: Jerry Thorpe (Director), Kris Kristofferson (Actor), Jane Alexander (Actor) & 0 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Drama Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {} Review Text: An engrossing look at early Hawaiian/mainland American interaction. Strong writing and powerful performances make this a stand out viewing experience. Review Title: Overlooked gem Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Spartacus: Gods Of The Arena - The Complete Collection [DVD] Review Date: 2013/11/19 Store: John Hannah (Actor), Lucy Lawless (Actor) Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Movies Product Description: ['Product Description', 'The House of Batiatus has towered above the city of Capua for many years.', 'Spartacus: Gods of the Arena', 'will explore its deadly history before the arrival of Spartacus, and the death he carried with him. Loyalties will be tested, lives shattered, and battles waged in this thrilling prequel to', 'Spartacus: Blood and Sand', '.', 'Amazon.com', 'The title is misleading--there is no Spartacus to be found here--but little matter, as', 'Gods of the Arena', 'is a prime example of making lemonade from lemons. Faced with the unavailability of Andy Whitfield, star of', 'Spartacus: Blood and Sand', ', due to a recurrence of cancer, the folks at Starz chose to go ahead without him and create a prequel, a resourceful way of buying some time until a new Spartacus could be found while employing several actors already under contract. The focus throughout these six episodes is on the house of Batiatus. It is there that gladiators hone their skills as they prepare for glory and/or death in the arena under the evil eye of Quintus Batiatus (John Hannah), whom', 'Blood and Sand', 'viewers will recognize as the principal villain of that series. The younger Batiatus, already blindly ambitious, wants to make his mark in the gladiator biz, aided by his sexy, scheming wife, Lucretia (Lucy Lawless), and her licentious friend Gaia (Jaime Murray)--and they have just the warrior to do it with in Gannicus (Dustin Clare), a preening stud described by one show exec as "Han Solo meets Achilles." There are, of course, numerous obstacles, ranging from Batiatus\'s own father to various rival gladiatorial operations. But really, who cares about plotting when a show has as much sex and violence, usually directly juxtaposed, as this one? True to the', 'Blood and Sand', "precedent, every episode offers a steady parade of gratuitous, risibly over-the-top beheadings and other mayhem, much of it lovingly shot in slow motion, along with ample nudity (some of it full-frontal) and sex (all of it soft-core). With drugs, torture, and constant profanity also in the mix (who knew the ancient Romans dropped so many F-bombs?), this is definitely not a program for the young and impressionable. Nor is it one that's big on nuance; almost without exception, Batiatus and his ilk are depicted as frivolous, depraved, and conniving, while the gladiators and slaves are lowly but noble (not to mention as gloriously muscled and sweaty as your average Chippendales dancer). But this isn't a documentary--it's entertainment, and on that level,", 'Gods of the Arena', 'totally works.', '--Sam Graham'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Sam Raimi, Peter Mensah, Robert Tapert, Steven S. DeKnight, Joshua Donen, John Hannah, Marisa Ramirez, Jaime Murray, Lucy Lawless, Dustin ClareSam Raimi, Peter Mensah, Robert Tapert, Steven S. DeKnight, Joshua Donen, John Hannah, Marisa Ramirez, Jaime Murray, Lucy Lawless, Dustin Clare See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '2', 'Runtime': '5 hours and 35 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '5.7 x 0.6 x 7.6 inches; 6.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '54098998098', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '5 hours and 35 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 13, 2011', 'Actors': 'John Hannah, Lucy Lawless, Dustin Clare, Peter Mensah, Jaime Murray', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish', 'Producers': 'Robert Tapert, Sam Raimi, Steven S. DeKnight, Joshua Donen', 'Studio': 'Anchor Bay Entertainment', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '2'} Review Text: Excellent prequel to Blood and Sand featuring all of the characters (except Spartacus) from the series. Highly recommended because of the intricacies of the storyline. Review Title: Visceral Entertainment Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Spartacus: Vengeance: Season 2 Review Date: 2014/08/04 Store: Liam McIntyre (Actor), Katrina Law (Actor) Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Drama Product Description: ['10-episode sequel to “Spartacus: Blood & Sand.” On the heels of the bloody escape from the House of Batiatus that concluded “Spartacus: Blood and Sand,” the gladiator rebellion continues and begins to strike fear into the heart of the Roman Republic in “Spartacus: Vengeance.” Gaius Claudius Glaber and his Roman troops are sent to Capua to crush the growing band of freed slaves that Spartacus leads before it can inflict further damage. Spartacus is presented the choice of satisfying his personal need for vengeance against the man who condemned his wife to slavery and eventual death or making the larger sacrifices necessary to keep his budding army from breaking apart. Containing all of the blood-soaked action, exotic sexuality, and villainy and heroism that has come to distinguish the series, the tale of Spartacus resumes in epic fashion. Includes tons of never-before-seen bonus features including featurettes, extended scenes and Content Too Risqué for CABLE TV.'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Rob Tapert, Sam Raimi, Peter Mensah, Steven S. DeKnight, Joshua Donen, Manu Bennett, Katrina Law, Lucy Lawless, Liam McIntyre, Dustin ClareRob Tapert, Sam Raimi, Peter Mensah, Steven S. DeKnight, Joshua Donen, Manu Bennett, Katrina Law, Lucy Lawless, Liam McIntyre, Dustin Clare See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '3', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.6 x 5.7 x 7.5 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': '540948195', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Run time': '9 hours and 16 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 11, 2012', 'Actors': 'Liam McIntyre, Katrina Law, Dustin Clare, Lucy Lawless, Manu Bennett', 'Dubbed': 'Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish', 'Producers': 'Rob Tapert, Steven S. DeKnight, Sam Raimi, Joshua Donen', 'Studio': 'Starz / Anchor Bay', 'Number of discs': '3'} Review Text: More blood. More sex. Does not disappoint. Review Title: More of a good thing. Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/12/07 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'frightening scenes', 'alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Marc Forster'], 'Producers': ['Brad Pitt', 'Dede Gardner', 'Jeremy Kleiner', 'Ian Bryce', 'Marc Forster', 'Brad Simpson', 'David Ellison', 'Dana Goldberg', 'Paul Schwake', 'Graham King', 'Tim Headington'], 'Starring': ['Brad Pitt', 'Mireille Enos', 'Fana Mokoena'], 'Studio': ['SciFi and Fantasy']} Review Text: Far more entertaining than I expected though filled with the usual Hollywood implausible action sequences. The hero has just too much good luck. But there are plenty of genuinely chilling sequences without being a zombie gore fest. Read the book too. It's great. Review Title: Chilling entertainment. Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2015/07/04 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Roland Emmerich'], 'Producers': ['Bradley Fischer', 'Harald Kloser', 'James Vanderbilt', 'Larry Franco', 'Laeta Kalogridis', 'Roland Emmerich'], 'Starring': ['Channing Tatum', 'Jamie Foxx', 'Maggie Gyllenhaal'], 'Studio': ['Columbia Pictures']} Review Text: Forget logic and reason. Forget anything that makes sense. Now you can enjoy the film. Review Title: Suspend disbelief Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/06/27 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['---'], 'Producers': ['Erwin Stoff', 'Michael Bay', 'Scott Gardenhour', 'Richard Abate', 'Matthew Cohan'], 'Starring': ['John Krasinski', 'James Badge Dale', 'Pablo Schreiber'], 'Studio': ['Paramount']} Review Text: Excellent action film but did not really convey
a. The ambassador asking for help on multiple occasions
b. The administration's lack of response. Review Title: Wished for more Rating: 3.0 --------------------------------------------------

raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The purchase history indicates a strong preference for documentaries and drama-driven narratives, particularly those exploring music and historical contexts, as evidenced by high ratings for films featuring in-depth artistic insights and unique storylines. The individual seems to favor cinematic works with rich character development and compelling narratives, often emphasizing emotional depth and societal themes.

Common themes illustrate an affinity for visceral and intense experiences, such as those found in historical epics and action-packed dramas that blend elements of violence and moral complexity. This suggests a enjoyment of productions that challenge the audience's emotional engagement and stimulate critical thought.

Quality preferences lean toward intimate productions with strong storytelling, as reflected in consistently high ratings for well-crafted, impactful titles. Price sensitivity appears to be moderate; while there is no strong inclination toward budget options, the purchases suggest a willingness to invest in quality content, as indicated by ratings generally above 4.5.

Overall, this individual exhibits a keen interest in thought-provoking entertainment that blends artistry with historical and emotional richness, and they demonstrate an appreciation for quality over sheer volume when it comes to their media selection.

target_interaction.title: Great writing and acting.
target_interaction.text: Like a lot of episodic tv today, The Strain usurps most movies in terms of story. And, lets face it, writing is the key to everything.
